org.nodes.classification

Interface Classified<P>

  • Type Parameters:
    P -
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Collection<P>, java.lang.Iterable<P>, java.util.List<P>

    public interface Classified<P>
extends java.util.List<P>

    Represents a list of items with associated class

    The normal functions for adding items become unsupported and are replaced with versions that include a class parameter.

    See {Classification.combine()} for the standard way of creating this type of data.

    Author:
    Peter

      • setMaxClass

        void setMaxClass(int max)
        Sets the maximum class to the given value. This function is useful when a classified set is required which contains no occurences of a class that should nevertheless be considered. For instance, when a dataset with few instance for a given class is split into a test and training set, it's conceivable that one contains no instances of the class. If the given value is lower than the current max class, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        max -
